column4: hey guys having issues with this broadcom 4318 wireless nic and have tried some guides and am stuck on extracting the .sys file I would appreciate some assistance when possible..
Have you tried System > Administration ? Hardware Drivers?
sorry dude I was getting something to eat but yes Ive tried that as well.
I have the bcmwl5.inf driver installed but I have to also extract the .sys file for the stuff to work

What happened when you tried Hardware Drivers? You should already have the firmware you need and thus shouldn't need to extract anything ( to check if you have the firmware, see if there are directories named /lib/firmware/b43 and /lib/firmware/b43-legacy )
when I do hardware drivers and click activate it gets to about 50% search and fetch whatever and stops

I don't reccommend ndiswrapper as the open source drivers for your chipset are fine once you have the firmware ( though installing ndiswqrapper and blacklisting b43 can both prevent the open drivers from working )
If Hardware Drivers didn't complete then it's not in use yet
You can download the file manually if Hardware Drivers is failing, or try simply running "sudo /usr/share/b43-fwcutter/install_bcm43xx_firmware.sh

thanks I appreciate it but I would like to know how the hell I managed to get the thing to work bc obviously it was not supported in the kernel..I am absent minded of what firmware I had to grab in order for it to work properly..

yeah I had tried something like that but it was telling me bcm43xx-fwcutter command not found and I had b43-fwcutter installed..so idk..ive always had probs with installing these stupid wifi cards and Id like to really get it to where I can do that crap in about 10 minutes of work
Be carefull not to use out of date tutorials, the command is now b43-fwcutter not bcm43xx-fwcutter
do you mind if I pm you?

Before you use any tutorial first check the official documentation and wiki.ubuntu.com *then* if there is no tutorial there make sure that the tutorial you are following explicitly states that it's for your version of Ubuntu
